Name: Painted relief fragment depicting a human head
Description: Fragment of finely sculpted limestone wall relief, with part of the head of a man wearing plain wig, painted black, the face painted red. Around the eye is drawn a neat cosmetic line, also painted black. This would be appropriate for the figure of a god, king or perhaps a high official, but not for a servant. The fragment comes from the temple to the cult of king Nebhepetra Mentuhotep, who reunited Egypt at the start of the Middle Kingdom. The temple was the main monument of the period on the West Bank at Thebes.
